column1: Santa Lucía Cotzumalguapa (Spanish pronunciation: [ˈsanta luˈsi.a kotsumalˈɣwapa]) is a town
column4: and a municipality in the Escuintla department of Guatemala.

column1: The municipality includes the Cotzumalhuapa archaeological zone
column2: including the pre-Columbian archaeological sites of El Baúl and Bilbao. It is the birthplace of president Carlos Castillo Armas.

column1: Santa Lucía Cotzumalguapa has a tropical monsoon climate (Köppen: Am).
The town has a team that plays in the Liga Nacional de Guatemala
column2: the top division soccer league in Guatemala.
